data.title: Activities — Baltimore Metro HOG
data.text:
Tuesday Chapter Ride to the Wild & Wonderful HOG Rally in Charleston, WV

Departure Location Royal Farms - Catonsville 6430 Baltimore National Pike (Rt 40 W Catonsville, MD 21228 Join Bob Brittingham as he leads an all highway ride to the Wild & Wonderful HOG Rally in Charleston WV. (Google Maps estimates about 355 miles and about 5 ½ to 6 hours, from the Catonsville starting location to the Embassy Suites, in Charleston WV, so we will be on the road most of the day, hopefully arriving in Charleston around 2:00/ 3:00 pm) Be sure to have an EZ Pass available. There will be numerous rest/ Gas stops along the way as needed.

Be at the Catonsville Royal Farms by 7:45am, with KSU at 8:00 am. Due to the distance, I have selected an all highway route. Also, Eric Evans will be our rear Road Captain on this trip, as he plans to have his truck & trailer, to haul some equipment for the rally.

At the present time, my planned route is: From the Catonsville Royal Farms, we will take Rt. 40 west to I-70 west, to I-68 West, to I-79 South to Charleston, them 77 S to 119 s turning Left on Rt 60 (Lee St) to the Embassy Suites Hotel on Court St. Anyone planning to join the Tuesday ride to Rally, please contact Bob Brittingham.

View Event →

Wednesday Chapter Ride to the Wild & Wonderful HOG Rally in Charleston, WV

Departure Location Royal Farms - Catonsville 6430 Baltimore National Pike (Rt 40 W) Catonsville, MD 21228 Join (Rich Crosby) as he leads an all highway ride to the Wild & Wonderful HOG Rally in Charleston WV. (Google Maps estimates about 355 miles and about 5 ½ to 6 hours, from the Catonsville starting location to Embassy Suites, in Charleston WV, so we will be on the road most of the day, arriving about Noon/1:00pm) Obviously there will be Rest & gas stops along way, as needed. Be sure to have an EZ Pass available.

Be at the Catonsville RoFo by 0545am for the pre-ride briefing, with KSU at 6:00am Due to the distance, Rich has selected an all highway route. At the present time, my planned route is: From the Catonsville Royal Farms, we will take Rt. 40 west to I-70 west, to I-68 West, to I-79 South to Charleston, them 77 S to 119 s turning Left on Rt 60 (Lee St) to the Embassy Suites Hotel on Court St. Anyone planning to join the Wednesday ride to Rally, please contact Rich Crosby.

View Event →

Wild & Wonderful HOG Rally in Charleston, WV

Wild & Wonderful HOG Rally in Charleston, WV

Wednesday August 21st to Sunday August 25th 2024

All Day

The 2024 HOG Rally will be held in Charleston, WV from Wednesday August 21st through Sunday August 25th, 2024.

There are numerous Hotels & Motels available in the area. Be sure to register, and reserve your room early.

Contact a Chapter Officer for more information.

View Event →

Friday Chapter Ride to the Wild & Wonderful HOG Rally in Charleston, WV

Departure Location Royal Farms - Catonsville 6430 Baltimore National Pike (Rt 40 W) Catonsville, MD 21228 Join (Kevin Penharlow) as he leads an all highway ride to the Wild & Wonderful HOG Rally in Charleston WV. (Google Maps estimates about 355 miles and about 5 ½ to 6 hours, from the Catonsville starting location to Best Western Hotel, in Charleston WV, so we will be on the road most of the day, arriving about noon Noon/1:00pm) Obviously there will be Rest & gas stops along way, as needed. Be sure to have an EZ Pass available.

Be at the Catonsville RoFo by 6:45am for the pre-ride briefing, with KSU at 7:00am Due to the distance, Kevin has selected an all highway route. At the present time, my planned route is: From the Catonsville Royal Farms, we will take Rt. 40 west to I-70 west, to I-68 West, to I-79 South to Charleston, them 77 S to 119 s turning Left on Rt 60 (Lee St) to the Embassy Suites Hotel on Court St. Anyone planning to join the Friday ride to the Rally, please contact Kevin Penharlow.

August - Baltimore Metro HOG Chapter Gathering

The August Baltimore Metro HOG Chapter gathering will be held at the Harley Davidson Store, on Saturday August 31, 2024. The meeting portion will run from 9:00am to 10:00am, and there will be a social hour from 8:00am to 9:00am before the meeting.

Hope to see everyone at this event.

For those interested, there could be a Chapter ride to a location to be decided after the Chapter Gathering.

View Event →

Chapter Ride to Strasburg Railroad

Departure Locations: 1) Royal Farms – Glen Burnie 930 Cromwell Park Dr. Glen Burnie, MD 21061

2) Royal Farms – White Marsh 5361 Nottingham Dr. White Marsh, MD 22262

Join Barry Rogers as he leads a ride to the Strasburg Railroad, in Strasburg, PA. This will be a mostly highway ride from Glen Burnie Royal Farms, to the White Marsh Royal Farms, then a Scenic ride to Strasburg PA.

Stage #1 - Be at the Glen Burnie RoFo by 8:15am for the pre-ride briefing, with KSU at 8:30am.

Stage #2 - Be at the White Marsh RoFo by 9:00am with KSU when the group from Glen Burnie arrives.

Strasburg RR Museum 300 Gap Rd Strasburg, PA 17579

View Event →

September Baltimore Metro Social Movie Night

Come and join your fellow HOG members for popcorn and a movie. We will be screening the movie “The Bikeriders”. Location will be over the Royal Enfield showroom at Baltimore Harley Davidson. The Chapter will provide sodas, water and popcorn. Please feel free to bring beverages (including adult beverages) and snacks. Doors will open at 6:30 pm, the movie will start about 7 pm and is about 2 hours long.

Robin Churchill

Activities Coordinator Baltimore Metro HOG

View Event →

September - Baltimore Metro HOG Chapter Gathering

The September Baltimore Metro HOG Chapter gathering will be held at the Harley Davidson Store, on Tuesday September 24, 2024. The meeting portion will run from 7:00pm to 8:00pm, and there will be a social hour from 6:00pm to 7:00pm before the meeting.

Hope to see everyone at this event.

The September meeting was moved to Tuesday night due to the HOG's at the Beach event the following weekend.

Friday Chapter Ride to HOG’s at the Beach 2024

Departure Locations: Royal Farms

#1) White Marsh #2) Glen Burnie

5361 Nottingham Drive. 930 Cromwell Park Drive

White Marsh 21162 Glen Burnie, MD

Join Bob Brittingham as he leads an all highway ride to Ocean City, Maryland for our annual HOG’s at the beach Event. Bob will meet at the White Marsh Royal Farms at 9:45 am for a pre-ride briefing, with KSU at 10:00am, and then head to the Royal Farms in Glen Burnie to pick up other riders.

From there we will head down Rt. 97 to Rt. 50, cross the Bay Bridge, and continue to the Francis Scott Key Family Resort in Ocean City.

There will be one rest/ Gas stop in Cambridge along the way.

The Official Chapter Ride will end upon arrival at the Francis Scott Key facility

Leg #1) If leaving from the White Marsh Royal Farms, be there by 9:45am for briefing, KSU @ 10:00am.

Leg#2) If leaving from the Glen Burnie Royal Farms, be there by 10:30 am for briefing, KSU when group arrives.

REMEMBER TO BRING YOUR EZ-PASS.

Francis Scott Key Family Resort

12806 Ocean Gateway

Ocean City, MD 21842

View Event →

Chapter Annual Mini Golf Tournament - Save the Date

SAVE THE DATE

START TIME TO BE DETERMINED AT A LATER DATE.

On Sunday October 6, 2024, come out and show off your putting skills at our Annual Mini Golf Tournament. Prizes for the best scores!

As in previous years, it will be held at the Churchville Golf Center.

After our 18 holes, we will enjoy some refreshments at the Arctic Circle, located right next door.

NOTE: Cost per round of golf last year was $6.00 (CASH only)

Location:

Churchville Golf Center

3040 Churchville Road

Churchville MD 21028.

Robin Churchill

Activities Coordinator - Baltimore Metro HOG

October - Baltimore Metro HOG Chapter Gathering

The October Baltimore Metro HOG Chapter gathering will bring us back to Tuesday nights for the winter months. The Gathering will be at the Harley Davidson Store, on Tuesday October 29, 2024. The meeting portion will run from 7:00pm to 8:00pm, and there will be a social hour from 6:00pm to 7:00pm before the meeting.

Hope to see everyone at this event.

Chapter Ride to Veterans Day Ceremony at Holly Hills Memorial Gardens

Departure Location:

Royal Farms – White Marsh

5361 Nottingham Drive.

White Marsh, MD 21162

Join Bob Brittingham as we ride to attend the Veterans Day Prayer Services at Holly Hills Memorial Gardens. (Ceremony starts at 11:00 am)

Be at the Royal Farms in White Marsh, by 10:00am for a pre ride briefing, with KSU at 10:15 am.

This will be a short 15 minute ride to Holly Hills Cemetery, and official ride will end upon arrival at Holly Hills. Optional ride to lunch afterwards.

Services will be held outside, so take weather in to account. If weather is not favorable to ride, feel free to meet us at Holly Hills Memorial Gardens

Holly Hill Cemetery

10201 Bird River Rd.

Baltimore, MD 21229

(Have a mask or face covering available if needed.)

Chapter Ride to Chapter Picnic at Rocks State Park

Departure Location

Royal Farms – White Marsh 5361 Nottingham Drive. White Marsh, MD 21162

Join Jim Bomberg as he leads a ride to the Baltimore Metro HOG Chapter Picnic at the Hills Grove Picnic area of Rocks State Park. This will be a short 45 minute ride, and the official ride will end upon arrival at the Picnic area.

EZ Pass will not be needed.

The admission fee to the picnic area is included in the ticket fee to the Picnic, so there will be short stop at the entrance to the picnic area to obtain entrance ticket.

Be at the White Marsh Royal Farms by 10:45am for the pre-ride briefing with KSU at 11:00am Hills Grove Picnic Area Rocks State Park 4001 St. Clair Road Street, MD 21154

August Baltimore Metro Chapter Social

Join us for a pleasant gathering on the water at Brewers Landing from 5:30pm to 7:30pm on Friday August 2nd. The manager says come early as they will be busy, but there will be plenty of Chapter members there if you arrive later. We now have reservations inside due to the heat and potential rain. Come out and socialize.

Location:

803 Woodrow Ave.

Essex, MD 21221

July Chapter Breakfast and Social (also a Ride)

Join us for the July Social for breakfast at Bullocks Restaurant in Westminster.

Ride - Departure Location

Royal Farms - Hunt Valley

11119 McCormick Rd.

Hunt Valley, MD 21031

This will be a Chapter Ride/ Social Event, to enjoy fellowship and the Breakfast Buffet at Bullocks Family Restaurant.

If you do not choose to ride, please meet at the restaurant - we have a reservation for 9:00 am. As of 6/19/24, the breakfast buffet is $13.95 plus drink, tax and tip.

Join Kevin Penharlow as he leads a Scenic ride to Gettysburg Bike Week Event, at the All Star Family Event Complex, in Gettysburg. PA. There will be no rest stops, and EZ Pass will not be needed. NOTE: There is a $20.00 entry fee at the All Star Facility. The gates open at 10:00 am

If the group desires, Kevin will stop at the Fallen Firefighters Memorial in Emmitsburg, MD on the way to Gettysburg, PA.

Be at the Royal Farms by 8:45 am for the pre-ride briefing, with KSU at 9:00 am.

Chapter Progressive Dinner Ride

Departure Location:

White Marsh Royal Farms

5361 Nottingham Drive

White Marsh, MD 21162

Our Chapter members have generously agreed to serve as host for the Progressive Dinner Ride.

Join Erice Evans & Rick Modlin, as the lead us on our Annual Chapter Progressive dinner ride. There will be stops on both the East and West sides of town.

Be at the White Marsh Royal Farms by 11:15am for the pre-ride breifing, with KSU at 11:30am.

NOTE: You must pre-register for this event.

The cost is $5.00 per person, and the event is limited to 20 bikes and/or 30 people.

Contact Julie Modlin or Robin Churchill to sign up.

View Event →

Chapter Ride to the Steven F. Udvar-Hazy Center (Air & Space Museum)

Departure Location:

Royal Farms - Glen Burnie 930 Cromwell Park Drive Glen Burnie, MD 21061

Join Kevin Penharlow as he leads a scenic ride to the Museum of Health & Medicine in Silver Springs. After visiting the Museum, Kevin will lead the group to the Air and Space Museum in Chantilly, VA.

NOTE: The admission to the Museum of Health & Medicine, and the Air & Space Museum are free, however there is a $15.00 parking fee at the Air & Space Museum.

Be at the Glen Burnie Royal Farms by 8:45am for the pre-ride briefing, with KSU at 9:00am

Museum Of Health & Medicine Air & Space Museum 2500 Linden La. (Forest Green Annex) 14390 Air & Space Museum Dr. Silver Spring, MD 20910 Chantilly, VA 20151

Departure Location:

Be at the White Marsh Royal Farms by 9:45am for the pre-ride briefing with KSU at 10:00am.

NOTE: The Char’d BBQ now accepts Cash & Credit Cards. Also, please remember to bring a kickstand puck in case we need to park on the overflow lot.

Location:

Char’d BBQ 15513 Hanover Pike Upperco, MD 21155

(We will be eating inside, so have a mask, or face covering available.)

23rd Annual Cops Ride.

Departure Location Harley Davidson of Baltimore 8845 Pulaski Highway. Baltimore, MD 21237

Come join us for the 23rd Annual Cops Ride. This is a fully Police Escorted ride, leaving from the Harley Davidson of Baltimore, and heading to the FOP Lodge #89 in Upper Marlboro, MD. Minimum Donation last year was $35.00 per person.

Registration begins at 8:30am, with scheduled KSU at 10:00 am

A COPS Ride T-Shirt, and a Lunch catered by Mission BBQ is included with your Donation. Once at the FOP Lodge there will be a Slow Ride completion with Cash Prizes, 50/50 drawings & Vendors.

Final location FOP Lodge #89 2905 Old Largo Rd Upper Marlboro, MD 20772

View Event →

Fish fry at the HD of Baltimore Store

The Buffalo Soldiers MC of Central Maryland with be holding a Fish fry at the HD of Baltimore Store on June 8, 2024

The Fish Fry will run from 12:00 Noon to 4:00pm (while Food Lasts)

The cost is a $25.00 Donation

Menu: Fried Fish, Fried Chicken, String Beans, Potato Salad, Baked Beans, Macaroni Salad, Bread, Desert, Soda & Water.

There will be a DJ - 50/50 Raffle -Vendors. (Raffle drawing at 3:00pm)
